intro: Jasione corymbosa var. glabra, commonly known as the smooth hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow ray flowers are surrounded by pale yellow disk flowers, which are essential for pollination. The smooth hawksbeard is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
